answers.answer: No its not related to your cold. The most likely cause is ophthalmic migraine also known as eye migraine. This usually does NOT have a headache with it. However in rare cases it can be due to diseases of the heart, brain and blood vessels of the head and neck.Us the search feature on this page and read about "eye migraines" and "transient ischemic attacks". Make an appointment today with your family doctor to have a general physicial and evaluation and also make an appointment with an Eye MD physician-ophthalmologist.If you smoke, have diabetes, high blood pressure, are on birth control pills, have a family history of heart disease, stroke or neurological problems like brain tumors or aneurysms the importance of this is extreme.Do not pass this off, get it evaluated quickly.JCH III MD

question: I have been fighting a cold for the past week, and today while I was sitting in class and looking at the paper I was writing on, my vision was a little funny. It was like I couldn't focus and then I began to see swirling in the bottom and side of my left eye. Then it became hazy and I couldn't really see anything in my peripheral vision. It stopped after about a half an hour and I got a headache afterwards. Could this be a side effect of my cold or could it be something else??
title: eye swirls and headache
